name: Spicy Roast Beef Sliders
author: Cindylee Bloomer
summary: Sloppy, melty goodness. Usually I make these roast beef sliders without the flour to thicken the broth into a gravy, so you can absolutely do it without the flour and just strain the meat before putting on the sliders and then use the sauce like an au jus to dip in on the side, but I preferred these with the meaty gravy. Reminded me of a grown up Sloppy Joe. Yum!
ingredients: ½ pound thinly sliced deli roast beef
1 (10.5 ounce) can condensed beef consomme, undiluted
1  jalapeno pepper, diced, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup all-purpose flour, or as needed
2 tablespoons spicy horseradish, or to taste
directions: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C)
Roughly chop roast beef until crumbly
Combine consomme, jalapeno, Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper in a saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer
Add roast beef, lower heat to medium-low, and simmer until heated through, 1 to 2 minutes
Add flour and stir constantly until thickened into a gravy, 3 to 5 minutes
Slice rolls in half without separating rolls from each other
Put bottom halves on a baking sheet and layer with provolone cheese slices
Spoon meat mixture on the provolone and cover with Cheddar cheese slices
Add a thin smear of horseradish and place top rolls on top
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes
